Comments: Only sold by nan.

Comments: Given to you right as you get Fencer. Supposed to be OP for when you get it.

Name: Buckler

Mage medium armor for Dervish.

Name: Bracer

Starting equipment.

Name: Ink Stick
Comments:
One-of-a-kind.
Otherwise the Blind might be too good if several party members could use this.

Name: Water Bangle
Comments:
This should actually be the best water resist item you can get. (Even though you can get lots of them early.)
Hoard them to fight the capital city moat boss.

Name: Plate of Wolf
Comments:
It's quite hard, but you can get this early on after you unlock Scholar.
You need to use tricky magic vs. the basement boss.

Name: Help the Prince
Comments: Weak damage, but has defense.

Earned from the rotten fish quest.
Should give the longest 100% bleed on attack of any weapon. That's what makes it a unique reward (and still useful late game maybe).

Name: Tuxedo
Comments: Equal PDef and MDef.

Name: Boomer Sword
Comments: The boomers can lend this to you.

Name: Prodder

Name: Butter Cutter
Comments:
Since it cannot kill, it should be kinda OP for when you get it.
ie, Level is inflated.
Note: I added Mug to it. This works well because you might not want to kill something while trying to steal from it.

Name: Butterfly
Comments: No-auto: Careful because it has no Flat PEva, but it is a ninja dagger so the auto suggestion is confused.

Exchange PAtk for PCritDmg.

Comments: Since it's stealable, it should have a lower sell value.

A common drop, so sell price must be low.
Also it's digested so it should be weak.

Comments:
A common drop, so sell price must be low.
And it's digested so it kinda sucks.

Name: Mirror Shield

One-of-a-kind.

Name: Red Hairpin
Comments:
For Warlock multi-cast madness.

Not sure how to balance. There are a few ways:
- Gives -2 MP cost, but is one-of-a-kind. (Too powerful?)
- Gives -1 MP cost, and is one-of-a-kind. (Too weak?)
- Gives -1 MP cost, and is two-of-a-kind. (Too inflexible?)
- Gives -1 MP cost, is one-of-a-kind, and also has a couple other bonuses.

Name: Master Sword
Comments: Strongest buyable.

Comments: Strongest buyable.

Name: Smelly Gi
Comments:
Applies self-poison, but is otherwise quite great for the level.
Idea: Combine with poison immunity accessory.
No-auto: Needs high PDef and/or PEva to make up for penalty.

Name: Master Dagger
Comments: Strongest buyable.

Name: Auduril
Comments:
Stong sword stolen from late-game bosses.
Not one-of-a-kind.
No-auto: Weakened a tiny bit. Was a bit too strong compared to diamond sword.

Name: Vita Crown
Comments:
Super boost to regen effects.
Should not be heavy so that it cannot be used on tanks.
One-of-a-kind.

Name: Construct Mail
Comments:
Become basically immune to damage-per-turn.
One-of-a-kind.
No-auto: Slightly lower PDef and MDef in exchange for bonus.

Name: Assassin's Cloak
Comments:
Designed to enable a Backstabbing Nomad Dagger build.
    > Actually, this makes no sense because crit Nomads will use En-Water to get crit damage from Mnd+Spi.
    > Is this something the Mimic can use? Or use the Mimic's equip all passive to put it on a Rogue?
Must be light armor so that a Rogue cannot use it.
One-of-a-kind.

Name: Ragebringer
Comments:
Axes have no weapon skills, so they need strong weapons to compensate.
One-of-a-kind.

Name: Royal Guard
Comments:
One-of-a-kind.
No-auto: Less PAtk because of special mod.

Name: Paladin Wand
Comments:
Combine with Wizard's "PDef Is MDef" and dual-wield for INSANE PDef.
Note: Maybe this needs to be a dagger? I might want to restrict dual-wielding wands because of how optimal it woud be for Mnd maxing.
Two-of-a-kind.
No-auto: Less Mnd than normal due to special mod.

Name: Ether Shield
Comments: Stealable. Reduce cost.

Name: Aura Focus
Comments:
Note: Since Nomads don't use MP, this is very strong on Nomads.
No-auto stats: Less Mnd because it is very strong.
No-auto cost: Droppable.

Name: Oily Sword
Comments: One-of-a-kind.

Name: Decapitator
Comments:
One-of-a-kind.
Has less PAtk than standard because the BasicAttack bonus is so strong.

Name: Artemis
Comments: No-auto: Less bad accuracy.

Name: Mage Masher
Comments: One-of-a-kind.

Name: Mage's Pike (Old)
Comments: One-of-a-kind.

Name: Master Material
Comments:
Get by defeating the superboss roaming the bottom of the ocean. (homage to FF7 emerald weapon)
Useful for scholars to have access to every monster magic.

Name: All Creation
Comments:
One-of-a-kind.
Useful for scholars to have access to every monster magic.
Note: Master Material already provides this bonus.

Name: Stone of Jodan
Comments:
Not one-of-a-kind. (Maybe?)
Used to trade for something. (Or maybe get it by trading a rare item to an NPC? "I'll give you a SoJ for it!")

Name: Nomad's Emblem
Comments: Synergizes with Nomads wielding Axes (variance).

Name: Nomad's Guard
Comments:
No-auto: Worse PDef. Better PEva.
Note: Since this can be found in the tram, you can actually acquire it right after getting the Ibek. So it shouldn't be TOO game-breaking.

Name: Beats Stick
Comments: One of few equipment that gives a speed bonus.

Name: Staff of Balance
Comments: No-auto: Has equal Mnd and Spi, but less Spi than normal.

Name: Guardian Angel
Comments: One-of-a-kind. I don't want people rigging their whole teams with re-raise.

Name: Spellsword Helm
Comments:
Note: Designed for Warlock as a build-maker item. Fill AP by chaincasting!
Note: Don't allow Nomad's to wear this. It would be too good.

Name: Grim Scythe
Comments:
Charge spells faster for synergy with Dervish.
Found in pyramid dungeon (or desert; around there somewhere).
Afterwards, in case you missed it, you can buy it in Shoudu region shops.

Name: Thresher
Comments: Purchased in Sara Sara region.

Name: Great Thresher
Comments:
Purchased in Shoudu region.
No-auto: No flat PPen, but has PPen per level.

Name: Battle Bow
Comments: Purchased in Sara Sara region.

Name: Razor Bow
Comments: Purchased in Shoudu region.

Name: Life Line
Comments:
No-auto cost: Droppable.
Careful: How OP would it be to have 3 mimic-sub-commands copy a slime coat and all of them use this sword to stay alive?
    Answer: Not really OP. I tested and it wasn't easy. Maybe with a bit more thought it could be viable.

Name: Soul Keeper
Comments: Should this be -XX% max MP or -XX flat MP? The latter makes this more viable for mages, less for fighters. Experiment.

Name: Mage's Pike
Comments:
One-of-a-kind.
No-auto: Slight stat adjustment to make it different from similar daggers.

Name: Guts Busby
Comments: No-auto cost: Stealable.

Name: Legend Spike
Comments: NOT one-of-a-kind. (Rare steal.)

Name: King's Guard
Comments: No-auto: Less PAtk because it's a defensive sword.

Name: Sange
Comments: Note: There is a deliberate shortage of late-game Ninja Daggers so that it is difficult to make a full party of 4 optimized evading Ninjas.

Name: Yasha
Comments: Note: There is a deliberate shortage of late-game Ninja Daggers so that it is difficult to make a full party of 4 optimized evading Ninjas.

Name: Stealth Cape
Comments: One-of-a-kind.

Name: Magic Finder
Comments: No-auto cost: Droppable.

Name: Seeker's Garb
Comments: Best magic find armor.

Name: Loot Finder
Comments: No-auto cost: is loot.

Name: Glasses
Comments: Note: Should not be buyable; Immunity to Blind items should be special.

Name: Sanity Ring
Comments:
Note: I don't want this to be buyable.
Some late-game bosses depend on Confusion and I don't want to trivialize them.
This should be one-of-a-kind. (Note that there is also the Ribbon which grants Confusion immunity, so you'd have 2 Confusion immunity accessories total.)

Name: Torpid Cuffs
Comments: No-auto cost: Sells for a lot so that you can sell it early and afford a bunch of things if you want to.

Name: Cosplay Garb
Comments: No-auto cost: Droppable.

Name: Savior's Cape
Comments:
Rare drop. Needs lower sell cost.
Strong with Chi Burst builds.
No-auto: Weak PDef and MDef in exchange for Additive Spi.

Name: Cleric's Hood
Comments: Purchased in Sara Sara region.

Name: Plague Mask
Comments:
You can find this before unlocking Dervish.
It might be useful for Dervish to poison all enemies while using the Reaper AoE MP absorb skill.

Name: Regen Crown
Comments: No-auto: Slightly lower MDef in exchange for a bit more Spi and automatic Regen.

Name: Ribbon
Comments:
Prize #7 at the Sky Arena.
Idea: Fights 8, 9, and 10 are extremely status heavy, and you need to use this on your fighter to beat them.

Name: Shadow Gi
Comments: No-auto: Low all-around stats in exchange for crit damage.

Name: Raven's Hood
Comments: A physical-oriented light helm. (For Weaver)

Name: Raven's Cloak
Comments: A physical-oriented light body. (For Weaver)

Name: Fairy's Crown
Comments: No-auto cost: Droppable.

Name: Flameseeker

One-of-a-kind.
Note: Has no Mnd in exchange for Fire damage boost.
Note: Should probably be the strongest wand when dealing fire damage.

Name: Sturdy Cape
Comments: High defense but no Mnd/Spi.

Name: Masamune
Comments: Flavor: Honjo Masamune (famous swordmaker)

Name: Ichimonji
Comments: Flavor: Fukuoka Ichimonji Sukezane (Given to Tokugawa Ieyasu as a gift)

Name: Nansen

Purchased in Sara Sara region.
Stronger than other items purchasable here because you can't even Samurai yet anyway.
Flavor: Nansen (made by Ichimonji)

Name: Hitofuri

Purchased in Shoudu region.

Name: Kunitoshi

Name: Tomokirimaru
Comments: Flavor: Tomokirimaru (obtained by stealing from a father as spoils)

Name: Muramasa
Comments:
Flavor: Muramasa (sword maker with no kokuho (nationanl treasure))
No-auto: Super high PAtk. Even better than diamond! But has no other attribute at all.

Name: Highland Blade
Comments: Purchased in Shoudu region.

Name: Cold Touch
Comments: Note: There is also an accessory that increases Ice damage that you can get two of. That's a lot of Ice damage bonus! Abilities should be balanced accordingly!

Name: Scimitar
Comments: Purchased in Sara Sara region.

Name: Defender
Comments: Defensive sword; is weak to attack with.

Name: War Axe
Comments: Purchased in Sara Sara region.

Name: Hatchet
Comments: Less Variance than normal.

Name: Axe of Light

For healing nomads.
And some MND for good measure too, to make this Axe worth the effort of obtaining it.
Note: Vanilla was +50% Mnd instead of +50 Mnd by mistake. Nerfed, but kept some of that power.

Name: Berserker Axe
Comments: Purchased in Shoudu region.

Name: Janbiya
Comments:
Purchased in Sara Sara region.
"Janbiya is the Arabic term for a specific type of dagger with a short curved blade with a medial ridge that originated from Yemen."

Name: Cinquedea
Comments: No-auto: More PAtk, but lose PAtk per turn.

Name: Bone Knife
Comments: Dropped by skeletons, so it needs to sell for cheap.

Name: Kowakizashi
Comments: Note: There is a deliberate shortage of late-game Ninja Daggers so that it is difficult to make a full party of 4 optimized evading Ninjas.

Name: Tachi
Comments: A tachi () was a type of traditionally made Japanese sword (nihonto) worn by the samurai class of feudal Japan.

Name: Kodachi
Comments: Purchased in Shoudu region.

Name: Nightingale
Comments: No-auto: Slight stat adjustment to make it different from similar rapiers.

Comments: Purchased in Sara Sara region.

Used for Lucky Dice build.

Best for red or blue mages.
No-auto: Slight stat adjustment to make it different from similar rapiers.

Name: Falcon Dance
Comments: Purchased in Shoudu region.

One-of-a-kind.

Has a lot less Spi than normal, in exchange for super Ice power.

Purchased in Shoudu region.
Idea: Buy one for everyone, and use Meteor at the start of fights.

Name: Wizard's Wall
Comments: No-auto: Low PDef because of other stats.

Name: Orion Armor
Comments: Purchased in Sara Sara region.

Name: Orion Barbut
Comments: Purchased in Sara Sara region.

Name: Raid Helm
Comments:
It is stealable so the sell cost should be low.
No-auto stats: Has an edge in Threat Gain compared to similar armor.

Name: Power Vest
Comments: Purchased in Sara Sara region.

Name: Gaia Vest
Comments:
Combo with Earth Split monk.
Careful: Don't let Samurai equip it or else it would be very strong on them too. But someone could subclass Samurai and use it like that.
No-auto:
- This is actually INSANELY good on a Monk late game. It needs to have pretty crappy defense to make up for it.

Name: Drifter's Vest
Comments:
There are several items a Nomad can use to boost water. Careful of how strong it would be to wear them all at once.
- Drifter's Vest
- Nomad's Guard
- Nomad's Emblem

Name: Onion Gi
Comments:
Grants extra vit in exchange for taking more Fire damage.
No-auto cost: Droppable.

Name: Red Hat
Comments: Need to have low sell cost because it's a drop.

Name: Combat Band
Comments: Purchased in Sara Sara region.

Name: Spring's Oath
Comments: One-of-a-kind.

Name: Fursuit
Comments: One of few equipment that gives a speed bonus.

Name: Quintar Pelt
Comments: Used for crafting the Fursuit.

Name: Hand of Midas
Comments:
Note: This is supposed to trivialize gold farming, since you earn it during ultra-end-game anyway.
Or it can be sold for a massive pile of cash.
Reward for beating The Sequoia (world tree) dungeon.

Name: Quiet Shoes
Comments: No-auto cost: Drops from common monsters.

Name: Burning Blade
Comments: Unique. Found in the volcano.

Name: Gold Crown
Comments: One-of-a-kind.

Name: Slime Coat
Comments:
Super strange armor.
Note: If the effect is a status, then mimics can copy it onto themselves.

Name: Snow Pendant
Comments:
No-auto cost: It's loot.
Be weary about which Nomad abilities this will power up.
Also be weary about which samurai swords this will syngergize with. It might be too good on Samurai if there are high level Ice swords.

Name: Panakeia
Comments:
No-auto cost: This is loot.
Note: Less spirit than a staff, but very comparable!

Name: Warlock Mail
Comments: No-auto: Stats are more like light armor than heavy armor.

Name: Rogue Vest
Comments: (Probably) the best equipment for increasing speed.

Name: Arctic Chill
Comments: No-Auto: Only one pierce type. Having both makes the description box too long.

Name: Bandage Wrap
Comments: No-auto cost: Is loot.

Name: Blood Hat
Comments: No-auto cost: Is loot.

Name: Blood Shield
Comments: No-auto cost: Is loot.

Name: Future Sight
Comments: No-auto cost: Is loot.

Name: Scope Specs
Comments: No-auto cost: It's sellable loot.

Name: Incursier
Comments:
No-auto stats: Has way high PAtk because of the repeat action downside.
No-auto cost: Is a drop/steal.
